intro: Nunnezharia tepejilote, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round berries that are edible when ripe. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
